Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "He's a very smart kid," Campa said. "He listens."
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: After being evicted from her apartment, Juanita Campa was homeless for years, eventually coming to live with her 4-year-old son and his father in the Jungle, an encampment along the edge of San Jose's Coyote Creek

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "It goes back to economic hardships, loss of jobs, displacement. There's just a number of reasons why our families are growing in our (homeless youth) population," Almazan said. "And some of our families haven't bounced back from that yet."

Adalat said district staff have seen many families facing unstable housing and multiple families living in a household. "We have students who are living in shelters. We actually have foster youth that are unhoused as well," she said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of student services at East Side Union High School District

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "There are a number of kids that we knew who were homeless who would show up late. Before we brought them to the classroom, we bring them to the cafeteria and grab them something to eat and grab them some milk so that they can have something in their stomach before they went into the classroom," she said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of Social Emotional Learning at the Alum Rock district

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "They leave the home really traumatized to begin with, and then they end up on the streets," Smith said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: professor who teaches childhood adolescent development at San Jose State University

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "I felt like I wasn't doing my job as a mom because we're homeless," she said "We were working but it wasn't enough. ... I don't want to be back here."

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Since 2020, the number of homeless students in Santa Clara County has almost doubled, according to the California Department of Education.
